title: Government approves spectrum trading norms for telecom firms
text: Government approves spectrum trading norms for telecom firms IANS | Sep 9, 2015, 02.09 PM IST With cabinet approving sharing norms, telecom companies can now trade spectrum among themselves. RELATED NEW DELHI: India on Wednesday approved the much-awaited spectrum trading norms for telecom companies, so that this scarce resource can be put to optimal use, communications and IT minsiter Ravi Shankar Prasad said here. "We have approved the spectrum trading norms today. Now the telecom companies can trade spectrum among themselves. For this they need not take any government permission," he said in a briefing after the cabinet gave a nod to the proposal. "The telecom companies only need to inform the government 45 days in advance before trading and they have to give an undertaking," the minister added.
